  • Method Details

    • generateSimilarColor

      public static com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color generateSimilarColor(Klotski klotski, com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color baseColor, float variability, float offset, float limit)
      Generates a new color similar to the specified base color, adjusted according to the provided parameters and theme constraints. The new color is created by applying random offsets to the RGB components of the base color, scaled by the variability parameter, and adding a fixed offset. The green component is intentionally reduced to minimize its presence. The resulting color's luminance is checked to ensure it adheres to the current theme's requirements (e.g., minimum brightness for light themes or maximum brightness for dark themes). If the luminance is outside the acceptable range, the method recursively adjusts the color with reduced variability until the limit threshold is reached or the luminance criteria are satisfied. The alpha value of the base color is preserved.
      Parameters:
      klotski - The context providing theme configuration and randomness utilities.
      baseColor - The starting color from which variations are generated.
      variability - The maximum range for random RGB offsets, controlling how much the new color can differ from the base.
      offset - A fixed value added to each RGB component after applying the random offset.
      limit - The threshold to halt recursive adjustments when variability is reduced below a certain level.
      Returns:
      A new color derived from the base color, adjusted for theme-compliant luminance and reduced green intensity.

    • calculateLuminance

      public static float calculateLuminance(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color color)
      Calculates the relative luminance of a given color using the standard sRGB luminance formula. Relative luminance represents the brightness of a color normalized to a reference white, following the ITU-R Recommendation BT.709. This is commonly used for accessibility standards to determine contrast ratios between colors. The formula applied is: luminance =0.2126 * red +0.7152 * green +0.0722 * blue, where red, green, and blue are the color components normalized to the range [0.0,1.0].
      Parameters:
      color - The Color object from which to derive luminance. Assumes RGB components are in a linearized (non-gamma-corrected) format and within the [0.0,1.0] range.
      Returns:
      A float value between0.0 (absolute black) and1.0 (absolute white) representing the relative luminance of the color.

    • rgbToHsl

      public static float[] rgbToHsl(float r, float g, float b)
      Converts RGB color values to HSL color values.

      This method takes normalized RGB values (clamped to the range [0,1]) and returns an array of HSL values where hue is represented as a fractional value in [0,1) (corresponding to0-360 degrees), saturation as a percentage in [0,1], and lightness as a percentage in [0,1]. The conversion follows the HSL color space calculation, accounting for achromatic colors (where saturation is0) by setting hue to0 in such cases.

      Parameters:
      r - The red component of the color (clamped to0-1 if outside the range).
      g - The green component of the color (clamped to0-1 if outside the range).
      b - The blue component of the color (clamped to0-1 if outside the range).
      Returns:
      A float array of length3 containing HSL values in the order: [hue (0-1), saturation (0-1), lightness (0-1)].

    • hslToRgb

      public static float[] hslToRgb(float h, float s, float l)
      Converts an HSL color value to RGB. The conversion follows the HSL to RGB color space transformation, where hue (h) is a normalized value on the color wheel (0.0 to1.0), saturation (s) is a percentage (0.0 to1.0), and lightness (l) is a percentage (0.0 to1.0). When saturation is0, the result is an achromatic color with red, green, and blue components all equal to the lightness value. The resulting RGB values are returned as an array of floats in the range [0.0,1.0].
      Parameters:
      h - The hue component (0.0 to1.0).
      s - The saturation component (0.0 to1.0).
      l - The lightness component (0.0 to1.0).
      Returns:
      An array containing the red, green, and blue components, in that order, each in the range [0.0,1.0].

    • hueToRgb

      public static float hueToRgb(float p, float q, float t)
      Converts a hue value to the corresponding RGB component using the specified parameters. This method is typically used in color space conversions (e.g., HSL to RGB) to calculate the red, green, or blue component based on the normalized hue value. The parameters p and q are derived from lightness and saturation values, while t represents the adjusted hue value normalized between0 and1. The method applies piecewise linear interpolation based on the hue's position within the color wheel segments (0-1/6,1/6-1/2, 1/2-2/3, and2/3-1) to compute the correct RGB component.
      Parameters:
      p - A component value derived from lightness and saturation (e.g., q = lightness * (1 + saturation)).
      q - A component value derived from lightness and saturation (e.g., p = lightness * (1 - saturation)).
      t - The normalized hue value, adjusted to wrap around if outside the [0,1] range.
      Returns:
      The calculated RGB component value (red, green, or blue) corresponding to the hue.
